p: The tail suspension method was described by Steru at al. [ 37]. It is a simple and reliable method for screening of antidepressant agents. After 30 min of administration of control (1% Tween 80, 10 mL/kg, p.o) standard (imipramine hydrochloride, 10 mg/kg b.w, i.p) and treatment groups (200 and 400 mg/kg b.w, p.o), the mice were induced in a depression state (immobility), hanging by end of the tail nearly 1 cm from tip of the tail using an adhesive tape. Total immobile time was recorded for last 4 min of a total 6 min (initial adjustment time 2 min) of hanging.
